repnme.cdata!:
Brazil, Philippines - Building institutions
            and financing local development : lessons from Brazil and
            the Philippines - Municipal Development Projects in the
            State of Parana and the State of Rio Grande do Sul, First
            and Second Municipal Development Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
This study assesses the impacts of
            municipal development projects (MDPs) on the institutional
            capacity building of local governments for fiscal and
            financial management and for planning and implementation of
            investment programs. It also assesses direct impacts on the
            beneficiaries as anticipated by the projects, and indirect
            side-effects on the development of local economies focusing
            on employment and income generation. The study evaluates the
            impacts of two successful MDPs, in the Philippines and in
            Brazil. They provide a rich base for the study to extract
            lessons for ongoing and future projects. Three sets of data
            were collected and analyzed: municipal finance data of local
            governments, a sample survey of mayors on capacity building,
            and a survey of stall-holders in public markets. At both the
            municipal and the beneficiary levels, the study compared
            impacts on the participating municipalities with conditions
            of the non-participating municipalities, and the initial
            conditions with the impacts after the project implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Municipal Development Project in
            the State of Parana

abstracts.cdata!:
Taking Brazil's municipal reform
            agenda some important steps further, the Parani Municipal
            Development (PEDU) Project (Ln. 3100-BR) was modeled upon
            its predecessor, the satisfactory Parana Market Towns
            Development (PRAM) Project (Ln 2343-BR). PEDU itself was the
            third municipal development operation supported by the Bank
            in Brazil. It was prepared jointly with the Municipal
            Development (PIMES) Project in the State of Rio Grande do
            Sul (Loan 3129-BR)-- approved four months later--with which
            it shared a similar design and set of objectives. The PEDU
            project was replicated by similar on-going operations later
            approved in the states of Minas Gerais (Ln. 3639-BR), Ceara
            (Ln. 3789-BR), and Bahia (Ln. 4140-BR). T'he objectives
            of the project were to: (i) Improve the managerial and
            institutional capacity and fiscal efficiency of
            municipalities and state agencies. (ii) Provide basic
            economic and social infrastructure in urban areas. (iii)
            Decentralize urban administration and financial management.
            (iv) Improve targeting of urban programs to lower-income
            populations. (v) Create and strengthen a State urban
            development fund (FDJ). To fulfill these objectives the PEDU
            project used Bank Loan proceeds and Parana state counterpart
            funding to capitalize a specially created Urban Development
            Fund (FDIJ), which provided a line of credit for investments
            in urban infrastructure and services by municipalities
            throughout the state. The PEDU project design required that
            FDU loans would be made to municipalities embarked upon
            institutional reform. Implementation responsibility for the
            project was in the hands of the state Secretariat of Urban
            Development (SEDU) and the Parana Foundation for Assistance
            to Municipalities (FAMEPAR). This arrangement brought to
            PEDU the considerable experience acquired by both agencies
            through the implementation of the earlier PRAM project.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Municipal Development Project in
            the State of Parana

abstracts.cdata!:
The Municipal Development Project in the
            State of Parana aims to improve the capacity of
            municipalities to effectively assume their increased
            responsibilities under Brazil's new constitution by
            enabling them to efficiently utilize their significantly
            increased fiscal resources. The project supports a state
            wide program (PEDU) in Parana which includes two components:
            (i) institutional and human resources development,
            consisting of technical assistance, training, and equipment,
            to municipalities to strengthen their financial management
            and overall administration; and (ii) infrastructure
            investments consisting of street paving and lighting,
            sanitation, drainage, community facilities, and other
            eligible subprojects, including pilot projects for
            low-income self help housing construction.

docna.cdata!:
Brazil - Municipal Development Project in
            the State of Parana
